title: Strong Algebras and Radical Sylvester-Gallai Configurations
abstract:
Abstract
In this paper, we prove the following non-linear generalization of the classical Sylvester-Gallai theorem.
Let 𝕂𝕂{\mathbb{K}} be an algebraically closed field of characteristic 00 and ℱ={F1,⋯,Fm}⊂𝕂​[x1,⋯,xN]ℱsubscript𝐹1⋯subscript𝐹𝑚𝕂subscript𝑥1⋯subscript𝑥𝑁\mathcal{F}=\{F_{1},\cdots,F_{m}\}\subset{\mathbb{K}}[x_{1},\cdots,x_{N}] be a set of irreducible homogeneous polynomials of degree at most d𝑑d such that Fisubscript𝐹𝑖F_{i} is not a scalar multiple of Fjsubscript𝐹𝑗F_{j} for i≠j𝑖𝑗i\neq j.
Suppose that for any two distinct Fi,Fj∈ℱsubscript𝐹𝑖subscript𝐹𝑗ℱF_{i},F_{j}\in\mathcal{F}, there is k≠i,j𝑘𝑖𝑗k\neq i,j such that Fk∈rad⁡(Fi,Fj)subscript𝐹𝑘radsubscript𝐹𝑖subscript𝐹𝑗F_{k}\in\operatorname{rad}(F_{i},F_{j}).
We prove that such radical SG configurations must be low dimensional.
More precisely, we show that there exists a function λ:ℕ→ℕ:𝜆→ℕℕ\lambda:{\mathbb{N}}\rightarrow{\mathbb{N}}, independent of 𝕂,N𝕂𝑁{\mathbb{K}},N and m𝑚m, such that any such configuration ℱℱ\mathcal{F} must satisfy



dim(span𝕂​{ℱ})≤λ​(d).dimensionsubscriptspan𝕂ℱ𝜆𝑑\dim(\textnormal{span}_{\mathbb{K}}\left\{\mathcal{F}\right\})\leq\lambda(d).



Our result confirms a conjecture of Gupta [35, Conjecture 2] and generalizes the quadratic and cubic Sylvester-Gallai theorems of [56, 49].
Our result takes us one step closer towards the first deterministic polynomial time algorithm for the Polynomial Identity Testing (PIT) problem for depth-4 circuits of bounded top and bottom fanins. Our result, when combined with the Stillman uniformity type results of [3, 15, 23], yields uniform bounds for several algebraic invariants such as projective dimension, Betti numbers and Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity of ideals generated by radical SG configurations.
